snippet: The excellent condition of a newly discovered 13th-century chapel has stirred hopes among archaeologists that an entire city may be largely intact underground.
abstract: Archaologists have uncovered well-preserved remains of 13th-century chapel once belonging to city of Myra, under modern town of Demre, Turkey; excellent condition of remains has stirred hopes that an entire city may be largely intact underground.
lead_paragraph: The excellent condition of a newly discovered 13th-century chapel has stirred hopes among archaeologists that an entire city may be largely intact underground.

headline.seo: Under Turkish Mud, Well-Preserved Byzantine Chapel
headline.main: Sealed Under Turkish Mud, a Well-Preserved Byzantine Chapel
headline.print_headline: Sealed Under Turkish Mud, a Well-Preserved Byzantine Chapel
